title: ESG - Data Operations - Manager
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. POSITION DESCRIPTION
KKR is building out an enterprise data group to collect, manage, and harness the power of data across our diverse portfolio investments. Reporting into the Global Markets Operations team, this group will help ensure all KKR data is accessible, consumable, and drive the curation of insights across the organization.
The KKR Data Operations group is seeking an experienced data management professional to join KKR’s ESG Data Operations function. Reporting directly to KKR’s Head of ESG Data Operations, this is an opportunity to facilitate the reporting, quality assurance and data collection needed for ESG Data across KKR’s Portfolio (inclusive of all asset classes).
This team member will manage the end-to-end ESG Data Collection and reporting process, ensuring required ESG data points are identified, that ESG data collected is high quality, well governed, and easily accessible to all internal stakeholders, and that all reporting requirements are met. This team member will come with direct experience with ESG Data as well as managing technical colleagues, and is unafraid to get into the weeds of data problems and analyses as needed.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage two India-based employees (one focused on reporting, the other focused on QA and Data Collection) ensuring high quality of work delivered
Facilitate annual review of ESG Data Scope - confirm if any data points need to be added or removed, which companies are in scope for ESG Data collection, and what edits need to be made to current data collection processes to satisfy regulatory and internal stakeholder requirements.
Enable and automate direct communications with Portfolio Companies, ensuring clear and concise messaging with proper KKR branding
Create and deploy solutions to reduce the work required from PCs to provide and report on ESG Data
Collaborate with engineering and IT to support and make recommendations for automated data reconciliation.
Ensure standards are developed for scalable processes throughout the lifecycle of a deal with well-defined information properly captured throughout that cycle
Develop and own critical business processes that maintain controls to ensure high quality data; seeking to systematically control & measure data quality (creating data quality rules and validations, implementing routine data quality checks, and introducing exception reporting)
Ad-hoc data projects supporting colleagues across the Data Operations group.
PRIMARY QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Strong technical skills in data querying & manipulation; must have advanced (expert) Excel skills and at least mid-level SQL querying abilities (selects, joins, etc.) – comfort with large sets of poorly structured data. Working knowledge of Python a plus
Basic analytical & data visualization capabilities (experience in using Tableau, Power BI or similar tools to support basic reporting).
Significant experience working with ESG Data in a Public or Private Markets setting
Strong Project Management skills - excellent written and verbal communication skills; detail oriented with strong analytical and quantitative skills, coupled with qualitative insight.
Collaborative and active contributor, with a “roll-up-your-sleeves” attitude in a fast-paced environment
Proven ability to manage demands of multiple projects in a fast-paced work environment, including ability to prioritize time efficiently and handle competing priorities while remaining connected to the details. Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines
High level of intellectual curiosity, accountability, and drive; self-motivated with the ability to work autonomously
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Accounting, Finance, Information Systems, or other related fields; and/or relevant industry experience
Experience with Power Apps/Power Automate a plus
Experience with Data collection software platforms a plus
